edu.uci.ics.crawler4j.crawler

Class WebCrawler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uci.ics.crawler4j.crawler.WebCrawler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class WebCrawler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    WebCrawler class in the Runnable class that is executed by each crawler thread.

      • getMyId

        public int getMyId()
        Get the id of the current crawler instance
        Returns:
        the id of the current crawler instance

      • getMyLocalData

        public java.lang.Object getMyLocalData()
        The CrawlController instance that has created this crawler instance will call this function just before terminating this crawler thread. Classes that extend WebCrawler can override this function to pass their local data to their controller. The controller then puts these local data in a List that can then be used for processing the local data of crawlers (if needed).
        Returns:
        currently NULL

      • getThread

        public java.lang.Thread getThread()

      • init

        public void init(int id,
                 CrawlController crawlController)
          throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                 java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Initializes the current instance of the crawler
        Parameters:
        id - the id of this crawler instance
        crawlController - the controller that manages this crawling session
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.InstantiationException

      • isNotWaitingForNewURLs

        public boolean isNotWaitingForNewURLs()

      • onBeforeExit

        public void onBeforeExit()
        This function is called just before the termination of the current crawler instance. It can be used for persisting in-memory data or other finalization tasks.

      • onStart

        public void onStart()
        This function is called just before starting the crawl by this crawler instance. It can be used for setting up the data structures or initializations needed by this crawler instance.

      • processPage

        public void processPage(WebURL curURL)
        Method which handles the processing of a WebUrl, i.e. a specific webpage, a) fetches the content of the webpage (the raw content) b) parse the content using the appropriate Parser (from the parser package) including a set of outgoing links c) iterates the set of outgoing links and determines if the should be followed based on your shouldVisit policy Note: Made public to allow for external testing and validation
        Parameters:
        WebURL - an instance of WebURL class containing the specific url address

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setThread

        public void setThread(java.lang.Thread myThread)

      • shouldVisit

        public boolean shouldVisit(Page referringPage,
                           WebURL url)
        Classes that extends WebCrawler should overwrite this function to tell the crawler whether the given url should be crawled or not. The following default implementation indicates that all urls should be included in the crawl except those with a nofollow flag.
        Parameters:
        url - the url which we are interested to know whether it should be included in the crawl or not.
        referringPage - The Page in which this url was found.
        Returns:
        if the url should be included in the crawl it returns true, otherwise false is returned.

      • visit

        public void visit(Page page)
        Classes that extends WebCrawler should overwrite this function to process the content of the fetched and parsed page.
        Parameters:
        page - the page object that is just fetched and parsed.
